document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the afrotropical species of Selenops Latreille, 1819 (Araneae, Selenopidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the afrotropical species of Selenops Latreille, 1819 (Araneae, Selenopidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Selenops radiatus
Latreille, 1819
. N. Dic. Hist. Nat. N. Edit. París. 1819 (Sélénope): 30, 579 . Female type from Spain , lost.

S. diversus
O .P.­Cambridge, 1898 . Proc. zool. Soc. Lond.: 387­391 , Pl 12 , fig. 10 . First synonymized by
Lessert ( 1936 : 262 )
.

S. krugeri
Lawrence, 1940
(male paralectoptype, not female lectotype ). Ann. S. Afr. Mus. 32 ( 6 ): 556 , fig. 3 .

S. radiatus
.­
Benoit, 1968
: Rev. Zool. Bot. Afr. 77 ( 1­2 ): 133 .

Diagnosis. The females of
S. radiatus
are easily distinguished by the shape of the epigynum (
Fig. 62
), the spermathecae (
Fig. 63
) and colour pattern of opisthosoma (
Fig. 64
). The males of
S. radiatus
resemble
S. annulatus
by the presence of a lateral projection on the tegulum (
Fig. 65
), which in
S. radiatus
is larger and not pointed as in
S. annulatus
(
Fig. 7
).

Female. For a description of the female see
Latreille ( 1819 )
,
Lessert ( 1936 )
, and
Benoit ( 1968 )
. Epigynum and spermathecae as in
Figs. 62­63
.

Male .
For description of male see
Lessert ( 1936 )
,
Lawrence ( 1940 )
and
Benoit ( 1968 )
. Palp as in
Figs. 65­66
.
